contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2011}} {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Infobox Prime Minister |name=Ernest Monis |image=Monis.jpg |order=74th [[Prime Minister of France]] |term_start =2 March 1911 |term_end =27 June 1911 |predecessor =[[Aristide Briand]] |successor =[[Joseph Caillaux]] |birth_date =23 May 1846 |death_date ={{Death date and age|df=yes|1929|5|25|1846|5|23|}} |party=None }} '''Antoine Emmanuel Ernest Monis''' ({{IPA-fr|ɛʁnɛst mɔni}}; 23 May 1846 [[Châteauneuf-sur-Charente]] – 25 May 1929 [[Mondouzil]]) was a French politician of the [[French Third Republic|Third Republic]], [[Chamber of Deputies (France)|deputy]] of [[Gironde]] from 1885 to 1889 and then [[French Senate|senator]] of the same department from 1891 to 1920. He was also [[Minister of Justice (France)|Minister of Justice]] in [[Pierre Waldeck-Rousseau]]'s [[Bloc des gauches]]'s cabinet (1899–1902) and [[Minister of the Navy (France)|Minister of the Navy]] in [[Gaston Doumergue]]'s cabinet in 1913–1914. Monis and his son were both injured in the opening event of the [[1911 Paris to Madrid air race]]. ==Monis's Ministry, 2 March – 27 June 1911== *Ernest Monis – President of the Council and [[Minister of the Interior and Worship]] *[[Jean Cruppi]] – Minister of Foreign Affairs *[[Maurice Berteaux]] – Minister of War *[[Joseph Caillaux]] – Minister of Finance *[[Joseph Paul-Boncour]] – Minister of Labour and Social Security Provisions *[[Antoine Perrier]] – Minister of Justice *[[Théophile Delcassé]] – Minister of Marine *[[Théodore Steeg]] – Minister of Public Instruction and Fine Arts *[[Jules Pams]] – Minister of Agriculture *[[Adolphe Messimy]] – Minister of Colonies *[[Charles Dumont (politician)|Charles Dumont]] – Minister of Public Works, Posts, and Telegraphs *[[Alfred Massé]] – Minister of Commerce and Industry '''Changes''' *21 May 1911 – [[François Louis Auguste Goiran]] succeeds Berteaux as Minister of War. {{S-start}} {{S-off}} {{Succession box|title=[[Minister of Justice (France)|Minister of Justice]]|before=[[Georges Lebret]]|after=[[Ernest Vallé]]|years=1899–1902}} {{Succession box|title=[[List of Prime Ministers of France|Prime Minister of France]]|before=[[Aristide Briand]]|after=[[Joseph Caillaux]]|years=1911}} {{S-end}} {{Heads of government of France}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Monis, Ernest | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = French politician | DATE OF BIRTH =23 May 1846 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH =25 May 1929 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Monis, Ernest}} [[Category:1846 births]] [[Category:1929 deaths]] [[Category:People from Charente]] [[Category:Prime Ministers of France]] [[Category:French Ministers of Justice]] [[Category:French interior ministers]] [[Category:Ministers of Marine]] [[Category:Members of the Chamber of Deputies of the French Third Republic]] [[Category:French Senators of the Third Republic]] {{France-politician-stub}}
